alert.note: Alert for East Feliciana; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; Washington; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 10:26PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WEST FELICIANA, ST. HELENA, NORTH CENTRAL LIVINGSTON, EAST FELICIANA, NORTHWESTERN TANGIPAHOA, NORTHERN EAST BATON ROUGE AND NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON PARISHES, PIKE AND SOUTHEASTERN AMITE COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM CST... At 1025 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Liberty to near Pride. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Zachary, Mccomb, Jackson, Clinton, Liberty, Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Magnolia, Kentwood, Independence, Roseland, Slaughter, Wilson, Osyka, Montpelier, Darlington, Pride, Felps, and Gillsburg. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 41 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: East Feliciana; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; Washington; West Feliciana
